intro: Alsocydia virginalis, commonly known as the Virgin's tears, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of fragrant blooms. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or forest understory environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
